nl.esciencecenter.neon.math

Class FloatMatrixMath

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.esciencecenter.neon.math.FloatMatrixMath

  • public final class FloatMatrixMath
extends Object
    Utility class for the more abstract Computer Graphics - related Matrix calculations.
    Author:
    Maarten van Meersbergen

    • Method Detail

      • getNormalMatrix

        public static Float3Matrix getNormalMatrix(Float4Matrix mv)
        Get the normal matrix from the modelview matrix.
        Parameters:
        mv - The Modelview matrix to extract the Normal Matrix from.
        Returns:
        The Normal Matrix for this Modelview Matrix. If the inverse cannot be calculated this will return an identity matrix instead.

      • ortho

        public static Float4Matrix ortho(float left,
                 float right,
                 float bottom,
                 float top,
                 float zNear,
                 float zFar)
        Helper method that creates a Orthogonal matrix
        Parameters:
        left - The left clipping plane
        right - The right clipping plane
        bottom - The bottom clipping plane
        top - The top clipping plane
        zNear - The near clipping plane
        zFar - The far clipping plane
        Returns:
        An orthogonal matrix

                       float aspect,
                       float zNear,
                       float zFar)
        Helper method that creates a perspective matrix
        Parameters:
        fovy - The fov in y-direction, in degrees
        aspect - The aspect ratio
        zNear - The near clipping plane
        zFar - The far clipping plane
        Returns:
        A perspective matrix

      • lookAt

        public static Float4Matrix lookAt(Float4Vector eye,
                  Float4Vector at,
                  Float4Vector up)
        Helper method that supplies a viewing transformation that allows us to look at the indicated point,
        Parameters:
        eye - The coordinates of the eye (camera)
        at - The coordinates of the object we want to look at
        up - The vector indicating the up direction for the camera
        Returns:
        A viewing transformation suitable for multiplication with the perspective matrix
        See Also:
        "http://www.opengl.org/sdk/docs/man2/xhtml/gluLookAt.xml"

        z - The z component of the vector that describes the axis to rotate around
